intro: Isonandra compta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Isonandra compta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial to full shade.
